Company Overview

Lawlabs Inc. is a dynamic team based in London, Ontario, comprised of law and tech professionals dedicated to revolutionizing the property closing experience. Our mission is to create a seamless and optimized conveyancing process that meets the evolving needs of lawyers and clerks, all while upholding our core values of trust and integrity.

Position Overview:

The Project Manager is responsible for tracking and facilitating Agile project delivery across software development teams. The role combines the responsibilities of Agile cross-team coordination, interdisciplinary facilitation, and project oversight to ensure the timely and effective delivery of high-quality software products. The role requires close collaboration with product owners, development teams, and business stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

Facilitation Duties

Recommend and implement tools and techniques that enhance productivity and transparency.

Facilitate all Agile touchpoints, including daily stand-ups, sprint planning, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
Act as a servant leader to support and guide the development team in following Agile principles and practices.
Remove impediments and resolve conflicts that hinder team progress or productivity.
Coach team members and stakeholders on Agile/Scrum practices to foster continuous improvement and team autonomy.
Project Management Duties

Develop, manage, and monitor project plans, schedules and resource allocation.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure deliverables meet defined requirements, quality standards, and deadlines.
Identify project risks and issues, develop mitigation strategies, and communicate project status to stakeholders.
Manage stakeholder expectations through clear communication and regular status updates.
Ensure proper documentation and compliance with internal standards and client requirements.

top_requirements.requirement: Cross-functional team coordination and stakeholder management
top_requirements.importance: The role explicitly requires serving as a key point of contact between development teams and external stakeholders, coordinating with cross-functional teams, and managing stakeholder expectations. This coordination ability is essential for project success.

top_requirements.requirement: Project management with risk identification and mitigation
top_requirements.importance: The PM must develop and monitor project plans, identify risks and issues, develop mitigation strategies, and ensure timely delivery of high-quality software products. This systematic project oversight is critical for meeting deadlines and quality standards.
